poem:
"Echoes of Earning"

A pence-piece rolls uphill, travail in the toil,
Echoing the rise from ten-four-two, 
Yet slips back, bound by a threadbare soil. 
Hear the hopeful hum of eleven-four-four,
Yet the chasmic lack, so cold and raw,
Leaves a thousand times a void for the poor.
In the vanguard of dawn, sketched in the cut,
A question persists - is it ever enough?
